t: God the Refuge of His People and Conqueror of the Nations
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A Song for Alamoth.
God*pn is*i our refuge and strength, A*ld very present help in trouble.
Therefore*ld we will not fear, Even*ld though the earth be removed, And*ld though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
Though*ild its waters roar and*i be troubled, Though*ild the mountains shake with its swelling. Selah*ipg
There*ipn is*i a river whose streams shall make glad the city of God, The*ld holy place*i of the tabernacle of the Most High.
God*ld is*i in the midst of her, she shall not be moved; God*ld shall help her, just at the break of dawn.
The*ld nations raged, the kingdoms were moved; He*ld uttered His voice, the earth melted.
The*ln Lord*s of hosts is*i with us; The*ld God of Jacob is*i our refuge. Selah*ipg
Come,*pn behold the works of the Lord,*s Who*ld has made desolations in the earth.
He*ld makes wars cease to the end of the earth; He*ld breaks the bow and cuts the spear in two; He*ld burns the chariot in the fire.
Be*ln still, and know that I am*i God; I*ld will be exalted among the nations, I*ld will be exalted in the earth!
The*ln Lord*s of hosts is*i with us; The*ld God of Jacob is*i our refuge. Selah*ipg
